paper_abstract: We consider Luciano Floridi's proposal for a structural realism based on an Informational Structural Realism which, as he describes in his book (p. 339): 'As a form of realism horizontal ellipsis is committed to the existence of a mind-independent reality addressed by, and constraining knowledge'. In doing this, we inform and reform aspects of the argument within a mathematical and, specifically, computability theoretic context.
paper_title: 'Real' information is not flat - and why it matters
